title: What would a member of the Scottish nobility wear to a banquet in the 14th century? - Quora

response.answer_text: This is the King of Scots David Bruce on the left meeting Edward II. A noble would not wear a crown. But would wear the embroidered broadcloth. There are no flying shuttles so broadcloth takes one person on either side of the loom to pass the shuttle across. Bear in mind that the nobility at this time was a handful of Earls.

There clothes would have been the same as those worn by the Nobility in England. Don’t imagine that they would have been wearing tartan as that is something of a myth and did not happen till many centuries later.

Pretty much exactly the same as what a member of the French or English nobility would have worn. Not surprisingly, since a number of Scottish noble families also had titles and lands in France and / or Scotland, and even more of them had fairly close relatives in the nobility of those countries.
